Michel Houellebecq (; born Michel Thomas; 26 February 1956) is a French author, filmmaker, and poet.
His first book was a biographical essay on the horror writer H. P. Lovecraft. Houellebecq published his first novel, "Whatever", in 1994. His next novels "Atomised", published in 1998, and "Platform" followed in 2001 were also his best known works.
